verses.verse: And the men <WH376> of Ephraim <WH669> said <WH559> unto him <WH4100>, Why hast thou served <WH6213> us thus <WH1697>, that thou calledst <WH7121> us not <WH1980>, when thou wentest to fight <WH3898> with Midian <WH4080>? And they did chide <WH7378> with him sharply <WH2394>.

And he said <WH559> unto them <WH6213>, What have I now done in comparison with you <WH5955>? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim <WH669> better <WH2896> than the vintage <WH1210> of Abiezer <WH44>?

God <WH430> hath delivered <WH5414> into your hand <WH3027> the princes <WH8269> of Midian <WH4080>, Oreb <WH6159> and Zeeb <WH2062>: and what was I able <WH3201> to do <WH6213> in comparison with you <WH7307>? Then their anger was abated <WH7503> toward him <WH1697>, when he had said that <WH1696>.
And Gideon <WH1439> came <WH935> to the Jordan <WH3383>, and passed over <WH5674>, he <WH7969>, and the three hundred <WH3967> men <WH376> that were with him <WH5889>, faint, yet pursuing <WH7291>.

And he said <WH559> unto the men <WH582> of Succoth <WH5523>, Give <WH5414>, I pray you <WH3603>, loaves of bread <WH3899> unto the people <WH5971> that follow <WH7272> me <WH5889>; for they are faint, and I am pursuing <WH7291> after <WH310> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759>, the kings <WH4428> of Midian <WH4080>.

And the princes <WH8269> of Succoth <WH5523> said <WH559>, Are the hands <WH3709> of Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> now in thy hand <WH3027>, that we should give <WH5414> bread <WH3899> unto thine army <WH6635>?

And Gideon <WH1439> said <WH559>, Therefore when Jehovah <WH3068> hath delivered <WH5414> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> into my hand <WH3027>, then I will tear <WH1758> your flesh <WH1320> with the thorns <WH6975> of the wilderness <WH4057> and with briers <WH1303>.

And he went up <WH5927> thence to Penuel <WH6439>, and spake <WH1696> unto them in like <WH2063> manner <WH582>; and the men of Penuel <WH6439> answered <WH6030> him as the men <WH582> of Succoth <WH5523> had answered <WH6030>.
And he spake <WH559> also unto the men <WH582> of Penuel <WH6439>, saying <WH559>, When I come again <WH7725> in peace <WH7965>, I will break down <WH5422> this tower <WH4026>.

Now Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> were in Karkor <WH7174>, and their hosts <WH4264> with them <WH2568>, about fifteen thousand <WH505> men <WH3498>, all that were left of all the host <WH4264> of the children <WH1121> of the east <WH6924>; for there fell <WH5307> a hundred <WH3967> and twenty <WH6242> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> that drew <WH8025> sword <WH2719>.

And Gideon <WH1439> went up <WH5927> by the way <WH1870> of them that dwelt <WH7931> in tents <WH168> on the east <WH6924> of Nobah <WH5025> and Jogbehah <WH3011>, and smote <WH5221> the host <WH4264>; for the host <WH4264> was secure <WH983>.

And Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> fled <WH5127>; and he pursued <WH7291> after <WH310> them <WH3920>; and he took the two <WH8147> kings <WH4428> of Midian <WH4080>, Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759>, and discomfited <WH2729> all the host <WH4264>.
And Gideon <WH1439> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3101> returned <WH7725> from the battle <WH4421> from <WH4608> the ascent of Heres <WH2775>.

And he caught <WH3920> a young man <WH5288> of the men <WH5288> of Succoth <WH5523>, and inquired <WH7592> of him <WH3789>: and he described for him the princes <WH8269> of Succoth <WH5523>, and the elders <WH2205> thereof <WH7657>, seventy and seven men <WH376>.

And he came <WH935> unto the men <WH582> of Succoth <WH5523>, and said <WH559>, Behold Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759>, concerning whom ye did taunt <WH2778> me <WH559>, saying, Are the hands <WH3709> of Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> now in thy hand <WH3027>, that we should give <WH5414> bread <WH3899> unto thy men <WH582> that are weary <WH3287>?

And he took <WH3947> the elders <WH2205> of the city <WH5892>, and thorns <WH6975> of the wilderness <WH4057> and briers <WH1303>, and with them he taught <WH3045> the men <WH582> of Succoth <WH5523>.
And he brake down <WH5422> the tower <WH4026> of Penuel <WH6439>, and slew <WH2026> the men <WH582> of the city <WH5892>.

Then said <WH559> he unto Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759>, What <WH375> manner of men <WH582> were they whom ye slew <WH2026> at Tabor <WH8396>? And they answered <WH559>, As thou <WH3644> art <WH259>, so were they; each one resembled <WH8389> the children <WH1121> of a king <WH4428>.

And he said <WH559>, They were my brethren <WH251>, the sons <WH1121> of my mother <WH517>: as Jehovah <WH3068> liveth <WH2416>, if <WH3863> ye had saved them alive <WH2421>, I would not slay you <WH2026>.

And he said <WH559> unto Jether <WH3500> his first-born <WH1060>, Up <WH6965>, and slay <WH2026> them <WH5288>. But the youth drew <WH8025> not his sword <WH2719>; for he feared <WH3372>, because he was yet a youth <WH5288>.

Then Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> said <WH559>, Rise <WH6965> thou <WH6293>, and fall upon us <WH376>; for as the man is <WH1369>, so is his strength. And Gideon <WH1439> arose <WH6965>, and slew <WH2026> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759>, and took <WH3947> the crescents <WH7720> that were on their camels <WH1581>' necks <WH6677>.

Then the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> unto Gideon <WH1439>, Rule <WH4910> thou over us <WH1121>, both thou, and thy son, and thy son <WH1121>'s son <WH1121> also <WH3467>; for thou hast saved us out of the hand <WH3027> of Midian <WH4080>.
And Gideon <WH1439> said <WH559> unto them <WH4910>, I will not rule over you <WH1121>, neither shall my son rule <WH4910> over you <WH3068>: Jehovah shall rule over you <WH4910>.

And Gideon <WH1439> said <WH559> unto them <WH7592>, I would make a request <WH7596> of you <WH5414>, that ye would give me every man <WH376> the ear-rings <WH5141> of his spoil <WH7998>. (For they had golden <WH2091> ear-rings <WH5141>, because they were Ishmaelites <WH3459>.)

And they answered <WH559>, We will willingly <WH5414> give <WH5414> them <WH6566>. And they spread a garment <WH8071>, and did cast <WH7993> therein every man <WH376> the ear-rings <WH5141> of his spoil <WH7998>.

And the weight <WH4948> of the golden <WH2091> ear-rings <WH5141> that he requested <WH7592> was a thousand <WH505> and seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> shekels of gold <WH2091>, besides the crescents <WH7720>, and the pendants <WH5188>, and the purple <WH713> raiment <WH899> that was on the kings <WH4428> of Midian <WH4080>, and besides the chains <WH6060> that were about their camels <WH1581>' necks <WH6677>.

And Gideon <WH1439> made <WH6213> an ephod <WH646> thereof <WH3322>, and put it in his city <WH5892>, even in Ophrah <WH6084>: and all Israel <WH3478> played the harlot <WH2181> after <WH310> it there <WH4170>; and it became a snare unto Gideon <WH1439>, and to his house <WH1004>.

So Midian <WH4080> was subdued <WH3665> before <WH6440> the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>, and they lifted up <WH5375> their heads <WH7218> no more <WH3254>. And the land <WH776> had rest <WH8252> forty <WH705> years <WH8141> in the days <WH3117> of Gideon <WH1439>.
And Jerubbaal <WH3378> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3101> went <WH3212> and dwelt <WH3427> in his own house <WH1004>.
And Gideon <WH1439> had threescore and ten <WH7657> sons <WH1121> of his body <WH3409> begotten <WH3318>; for he had many <WH7227> wives <WH802>.
And his concubine <WH6370> that was in Shechem <WH7927>, she also bare <WH3205> him a son <WH1121>, and he called <WH7760> his name <WH8034> Abimelech <WH40>.

And Gideon <WH1439> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3101> died <WH4191> in a good <WH2896> old age <WH7872>, and was buried <WH6912> in the sepulchre <WH6913> of Joash <WH3101> his father <WH1>, in Ophrah <WH6084> of the Abiezrites <WH33>.

And it came to pass <WH1439>, as soon as Gideon was dead <WH4191>, that the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> turned again <WH7725>, and played the harlot <WH2181> after <WH310> the Baalim <WH1168>, and made <WH7760> Baal-berith <WH1170> their god <WH430>.

And the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> remembered <WH2142> not Jehovah <WH3068> their God <WH430>, who had delivered <WH5337> them out of the hand <WH3027> of all their enemies <WH341> on every side <WH5439>;

neither showed <WH6213> they kindness <WH2617> to the house <WH1004> of Jerubbaal <WH3378>, who is Gideon <WH1439>, according to all the goodness <WH2896> which he had showed <WH6213> unto Israel <WH3478>.
